This coat/anorak is beautifully styled, easy to get into, very warm, and enhanced with multiple zippered pockets (all of which are on the outside of the coat and constitute asymmetrical design elements). review.reviewBody: Just used these gloves out west in Vail and Beaver Creek. Best gloves I've ever had! The comfort and warmth were perfection!
review.name: THE BEST!!

review.reviewBody: They seem to be well-made with nice leather, but they do not keep my fingers warm at all. And the cuff is way too small to use as a ski glove.
review.name: Well made but NOT warm

review.reviewBody: Would have have these gloves a five star review if they were a little warmer. The size was right on based on the size chart. Skied the last two weekends at above 15 deg temps. Finger tips were a little stingy on the lift and had to ball up my hand to get them warm. For this price I would not of expected this. The construction of this glove and fit are amazing. Nice soft liner and leather!
review.name: Almost 5 stars

review.reviewBody: I own these in the mitten form but needed more dexterity for handling poles during a recent trip to Austria for a split board trip. Swany are my go to for quality and warmth. These gloves gave me plenty of both. It was regularly -14c and these kept my hands toasty, especially against wind. Highly recommend these.
review.name: Perfect for big pow days

review.reviewBody: These are beautiful gloves with all of the features.  The leather is supple and the glove are flexible.  I have not tested them in the cold yet but I look forward to next season.
review.name: Peppers

review.reviewBody: I've gone through so many different pairs of ski gloves over the years dealing with poor warmth to poor quality. But the search is finally over. These gloves are incredibly warm and the quality is top notch. The leather is so soft and supple allowing for amazing dexterity straight away. There is no waiting to break them in, which is a huge win in my book. I haven't had to use it yet, but I really like the utility pocket for hand warmers, so much better than having to stuff it into your glove directly. The liners are so soft and comfortable too. All this for half the price of comparable gloves too. I highly recommend these gloves!
review.name: The Search is Over

name: X-Cell Glove - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Equipe RS S9 JohDah Winter Bib Tight - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I was very skeptical and hesitant to spend that much money on winter tights. I tried few cheaper but nice options first and none really appeal to me. So, why spend little money on something I will not use and like. So - I got this version and from first look and touch - I could see the difference. After two rides - I knew that I will keep it...and after few more long rides including a 100 miler gravel race with temps range from 22 degrees Fahrenheit
 to 48 degrees - the tight was perfect - I was not cold at 22 and was not hot at 48 - perfect temperature and moisture management.
review.name: Premier cold weather tights

name: Equipe RS S9 JohDah Winter Bib Tight - Men's

review.reviewBody: There are several stores that advertise this hat for the same price, Village Hats, Texas Boot Company, to name a couple that I have bought Stetsons & Bailey’s from. I bought a Stetson Royal Deluxe back in March from Backcountry and was very happy with my purchase. Not this time. The hat was either damaged or a “seconds”. There is a noticeable cut on the brim in the back. There were no cuts or slashes on the outer box nor the Stetson box so it was obviously that way when they sent it. $165 is a lot to pay for a less than pristine hat. Wish I had known, I would have passed, can’t exchange it because it was the last medium in burgundy. Guess it is a crap shoot to buy the last one. It should have been discounted further if it was damaged. Guess I won’t be buying anymore hats from here, and I buy LOTS of hats.
review.name: Very Disappointing…

review.reviewBody: This Stetson means business. Larger than I expected but not in a bad way. The band and feather is a nice touch to make you festival ready. 7 3/8ish in a fitted and the large fit perfect
review.name: Large & in charge

review.reviewBody: I wore this with a crew neck tee, jean jacket, cuffed jeans, and leather boots. I recieved many compliments, and caught the eye, of a couple of ladies!
review.name: an amazing hat!

review.reviewBody: After some shipping issues that were corrected the right size hat arrived.  Quality, style and fit were right on  Wore the hat just twice and both time received lots of complements.  Its not for everyone but if you have lots of hats this is a good one for your collection.
review.name: Lots of complements

name: Oceanus Hat

review.reviewBody:
Got these goggles on sale, second pair. 
Came off the LEATT 6.5, those can’t even touch smith. 
The smith’s are lighter, better field of vision, scratch resistant and flexible on the face for a perfect fit. 
Would absolutely buy again. Would interested In trying the Rythm with the outriggers from smith. 10/10
review.name: Best field of view

review.reviewBody: Love that is comes with a clear lens too. Works great and I don’t have to worry about fogging up my lens anymore.
review.name: Love that is comes with

review.reviewBody: These are nice and comfortable. Good ventilation, the clarity was excellent, fast shipping, and look nice as well. I would definitely recommend if your looking for a decent not to expensive pair of goggles. Match the smith helmet I bought very well also. I will definitely buy from this company again in the future :)
review.name: Perfect fit and great looking!

review.reviewBody: I got the clear lens squad XL and so far they've been great, especially at the pricepoint relative to alternatives. I primarily use these goggles for winter riding in low temps (35F and lower) Comfortable fit and most importantly, little fogging due to the substantial ventilation.
review.name: Great Value Goggle

review.reviewBody: My Smith Squad XL are just another great product that I have purchased and use on the slopes. I really like the extended view from the googles wide access frame and the material cushions against my face and allows free flow without clouding my vision. Following the sun on the slopes the Lense allows my eyes to focus on all the deviations on the hill. A wonderful product that allows me to ski to the best of my ability.
review.name: My Smith Squad XL are

review.reviewBody:
I’ve actually bought them as a winter goggle since the price point was so good. 

They work great! The standard that can be expected from Smith. I will likely buy these goggles again and again.
review.name: Smith XL MTB Goggle

review.reviewBody: Great downhill mtb goggles. Initially ordered the Squad MTB goggles but returned them because they had annoying tear-off posts. Squad XL has much better field of view.
review.name: Solid DH MTB goggles

review.reviewBody: Fit perfect with my Smith helmet. I do wish the lenses were easier to swap but it's not a huge deal.
review.name: Fit perfect with my Smith

review.reviewBody: The squad XL design is slightly larger. I like the way they are positioned on my face. Plenty of vision, no riding up on my cheeks. The goggles fit well in my helmet and stay in place. I ride knowing they fit, stay in place and offer a large field of vision.
review.name: SquadXL MTB

review.reviewBody:
Been using these with the Smith Mainline helmet and they are great. 

Happy with the fit and performance.
review.name: Great goggles

name: Squad XL MTB ChromaPop Goggles

review.reviewBody: I've had Thule crossbars on my minivan for 4-5 years and have loved them! Recently we bought a new minivan so of course, I immediately ordered new crossbars that would fit my new van. Unfortunately, these crossbars whistle and are super noisy. I'm guessing it's just because they have such a large profile. We've had to resort to removing them in between trips because the whistling is so annoying. So sad. I want to love them like I did my last crossbars (which were Aeroblades)... but I just can't. Buyers remorse.
review.name: Noisy

review.reviewBody:
1. it obviously said guaranteed fit and it didn't fit my truck.
2. The support has no idea what they're talking about, he didn't even know there's two types of roof racks on the bronco sports. 
3. The dude lied to me on the phone and told me he was going to ship the replacement that day and shipped it 8 days later.
4. One of the packages I received was missing parts.
review.name: Guaranteed fit doesn't mean anything.
comment:
Hello Jake,

Thank you for leaving your feedback and alerting us to this issue with your vehicle fit! I understand this was a frustrating experience and I'm glad to see our customer support team was able to assist.

Thule works hard to ensure all our fits are guaranteed, as you say. If there are any miscommunications on our fit guide, our team does what we can to fix the issue and correct the error. This process does take some time to initiate, especially when troubleshooting and confirming correct fitment, so same-day shipments are unfortunately usually not possible. It looks like a return and exchange was started immediately, and was released as soon as we received confirmation that the returned bar was shipped. I am sorry about the confusion on this process.

The Thule Customer Support team will certainly be able to assist with any missing components of your roof rack system as quickly as possible.

review.reviewBody: I've had these on my jeep for awhile now. The things I like are quality easy install and quiet going down the road.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Awesome updated product, but the 2013-2016 Mercedes Benz GL 5-door needs 721300 and 721400, the selector shows both 721300's, but its too short for the front.
review.name: Awesome updated version but sizes might be off

review.reviewBody: Wingbar edge is very noisey. I  contacted Thule about it and they responded by saying the issue was resolved, which it wasn't. Also I wasn't able to register my products.
review.name: Wingbar edge

review.reviewBody: This is a great roof rack! It is built very well. Installation was a breeze. It helps to have another person assist with initially placing the bars on the vehicle to prevent scrathing the paint but can be installed as I did, by myself. Love this roof rack. The only thing I was a little disappointed with was the fact it did not come with the keyed cylinder locks but rather simple plastic lock in place cylinders that you apply by turning with a flat head screwdriver. The keyed cylinder locks are a separate purchase if you want them for added security. Still not enough to overcome my satisfaction with this system. As to be expected, there is a slight whistle noise that is created by the rack being installed on the roof, but was really only noticeable for me with the moon roof open or vented. I believe Thule makes an optional panel that fits the front rack making the system more aerodynamic if needed or wanted.
review.name: Thule Edge Roof Rack System 2022 Ford Maverick

review.reviewBody:
I got these wingbars for a Q3, they are phenomenal!
They are light, easy to set up (~1hr. - less for someone experienced with them), look great in black. I have no concerns with them becoming loose or not being able to handle the load. I'll be leaving them on year 'round for building supplies. 
Highly recommend.
review.name: Sleek and Durable

review.reviewBody: Everything about this, from the clear instructions to the helpful customer service calls, to the superb engineering has made this purchase a great choice.  Price is only thought about when you buy something; but good quality far outweighs it over time.
review.name: Beautiful Engineering

review.reviewBody: Minimal noise at highway speeds on my VW id4.  Looks really great.
review.name: Perfect for id4

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my new Hyundai Ioniq 5, which doesn't come with any built in rack mounts, so I bought the Wingbar to attach via the door clamps. It looks cool and is super solid. The instructions that came with were easy to follow so was able to mount in ca. 30 mins. I'm still waiting to receive the roof box that will go on top, but it fits my canoe well and undoubtedly tons of other stuff.  The only downside is that it adds significant wind noise above 50 mph.  Note this car is fully electric, so starting with no engine noise, the wind noise from the rack is very noticeable.  Looking forward to a long road trip to test out the rack, box, and the interstate EV charging network.
review.name: works great
comment:
Thank you for your feedback, Blair! 
It sounds like there may be a gap somewhere in your Thule WingBar Edge installation. If the rubber gasketing on the top of the bar is not installed completely to the edges of the crossbar, and the feet are not securely installed, the gaps in the system can act as whistles at higher speeds. 
Checking this and securing the system will ensure quieter operation of this low-profile system.

name: WingBar Edge 77cm Roof Bar - 1-Pack

review.reviewBody: These shoes deliver the locked-in feeling of clipless with the full freedom of a pair of flats. The Ultread sole is just the right amount of sticky and hasn't shown even a single pinhole after a few rides, and the hexagonal pattern allows for just enough side-to-side motion to keep my feet comfortable on long climbs. These are perfect shoes for rowdy enduro days, but might be a bit overkill for chill trail rides. They do run a bit on the larger side. I'm normally a 7.5 US, and the size 41 is a definitely roomy in the toe box, but I've had zero heel slip so far.
review.name: Clipless grip with flats freedom

name: GF600 MTB Flat Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I am thoroughly impressed by the quality of this backpack. My load was 16–22kg for the 600km 30k mAlt thruhike from Scuol to Trieste over the Dolomites. And it was so comfortable! The ability to precisely adjust the back lenght and the hip belt are just next level. 
I also appreciated the 2 long pockets to organize stuff I could access quickly. The ability to load something between pack and frame is the feature that sold me on this one. I am a painter and my pochade box fit perfectly. 
There are numerous ways to attach things, like a solar panel.
Of course, I could lament the weight of this pack, but I’d rather carry a bit more for this level of versatility and comfort.
And it is tough. Nothing broke. Amazing.
Thank you for making this.
review.name: An absolute beast

review.reviewBody: I bought a Bridger 45 to use as a 72-hour Go Bag some time ago, and absolutely love the Bridger, and all of its’ great features, but it proved to be too small for the 72-hour Go Bag components that I needed to hold. Truth be told, I look at a 72-hour Go Bag as a long-term bag, considering that it is what you will have on your back if you have to go, so it needs to potentially hold items for longer-term. I am Army Special Forces, so this concept is baked into my DNA from years of training and on the ground experiemce. The Terraframe 80 will hold everything you need and more, and it fits extremely well and feels lighter than it actually weighs while carrying it. The option of expanding it to hold other items between the frame and the pack, like hunting supplies, a larger tent, game, or even a plate carrier and kit is also huge. One note, also based on my background, is that I personally want a smaller version of the kit to sustain me if I have to drop the pack and run. The top pack can certainly hold some of those basics, but you have to detach it and then also detach the shoulder straps from the frame to carry it, which isn’t very fast. To mitigate that, I also purchased an In And Out 19 pack and put my drop and run supplies in there, and place it on top of the pack and then close the top over it, and that works out perfectly. You can also then use the In And Out 19 for short forays if needed. The BL is that the Terraframe 80 meets all of my needs and I highly, highly recommend it for use as a 72-hour + Go Bag, but also for general pack purposes. It is impressive. I would also recommend the In And Out 19 to use in conjunction with it as described, and I attached Forager Pockets to either side of the hip belt on the main bag to carry lights, radios, and etc. for easy access. Well done, Mystery Ranch.
review.name: Perfect for my needs

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack to go hike the Trans Catalina Trail in October. I live in middle of the country and need a little bigger pack to hold some extra items when traveling. I have packed and have used the backpack around the trail at home and enjoy the extra padding and comfort this pack provides. I have a Bridger 65 and really like the pack but I need a little more space.
review.name: Great backpack for long journeys

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for my husband, who I'm starting to drag out on backpacking trips. It's his first pack ever. The fitting process was a little confusing, but he's a logistical wizard so he got it figured out at home before we set off. I wanted to steal his pack for our whole backpacking trip. It has SO many more convenient features than other standard-issue "backpacking backpacks". You can attach a zillion things to the outside, the top is super accessible, the side zip access actually works, and I can already tell the overload feature will be helpful for lugging extra weird stuff around (photography equipment for out in the wilderness, extra stuff smooshed in there for checking on a plane, really anything). I think it's bananas they don't make 80L for women. If you're backpacking a long way solo, it's an annoying Tetris game to find stuff in a standard pack. Gimme room!
review.name: Awesome pack, wish they'd make a women's version

review.reviewBody:
Overall a very durable and comfortable backpack allowing pretty serious flexibility in how you can carry things. 

The bag is very comfy with rigid and thick padding in the hip belt which sites nicely when the waist strap is cranked pretty tight. My average pack weights have been 50-70lbs and this makes them feel closer to 30-50 which is very impressive. The frame stays can basically mold to your pack which means items in overload are held snugly in place, I've carried sleeping pads, wool blankets, rifles, hard cases, winter (-20) rated insulation, cold weather clothing, firewood, and tents over long distances and this has been no problem. 

The ability to basically double the volume of the bag with overload is super versatile and for winter campers means that you can pack out adequate warmth without breaking your lumbar. Plus being able to carry pelican cases easily means less equipment liability and less of my supervisors being mad at me for dropping stuff off mountains. 

Material choice is a great blend of durable and lightweight however when compared to a friend's SATL I would much prefer the higher denier fabric on the mil packs. The SATL/Military buckles and clips are also much much higher quality and frankly MR should make them the defacto for all their bags as the weight difference is negligible in a fully loaded bag. Larger mil style clips/buckles are also easier to use with gloves in the winter. 

Main improvements for the bag could be: runners vest style soft bottle carriers on front harness, mil quality plastic components, and higher denier fabrics (500/mil cordura). If y'all could please make an 80-100L SATL style bag with overload then field exploration work wouldn't suck monkey nuts and my back would be saved. 

Highly recommend the terraframe, this bag has been an absolute pleasure to carry heavy items and provides a sense of load security that few bags can match. MR's implementation of overload is a killer feature (even against competing meat shelves) with how simple and efficient it is to set up and use.
review.name: Comfortable and Very Adaptive Bag!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this Terraframe 80 in the spring of '23 and used to on an 80+ mile backpacking trip through the mountains of New Mexico over the 4th of July week.  This pack never failed me!  I carried about 70 lbs for most of the trip and always had spare space.  The pack was comfortable and I was able to balance the pack perfectly.  The two long pockets were great for holding tent stakes, maps, and other odds and ends.  The pack withstood rain, triple-digit heat, brushes with rocks, trees, and thorned bushes without issues or tears.  The two side pockets were easy to reach with the pack on and more than big enough to hold my rain jacket, pack cover, and water bottle.  The internal water bladder pocket easily held my 3-liter bladder with no excessive pressure or pinching.  The two rows of webbing on the kidney pads held a small MOLLE pouch for easy access, on-the-go, snacks.  I did not get a chance to use the expandable cargo space or the detachable daypack.  Instead of the detachable daypack, I used a Mystery Ranch In-and-Out 19, which complemented the Terraframe 80 perfectly.  The only thing I would add to this pack is a couple rows of webbing on each side of the pack to add extra external MOLLE pouches or straps to better secure long gear such as hiking poles or hatchets.  However, this pack worked great for this trip and I can't wait to use it on future trips!
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.reviewBody: Very good fit, 6'1''  250 pounds and i took Large. Good quality and ultra light weight for all what the pack can do.
review.name: Terraframe 80

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack a few months ago in preparation for a through hike in the Bob Marshall. This will be my 3rd through hike and the most comfortable! I did not have shabby gear the first two times but this is an unbelievably comfortable pack. The storage it provides is versatile. We just took a trip from Montana to Nevada and I was able to fit it in the over head storage even on our small Montana connecting flights. I am now using the lid as a day pack as we hike around Nevada. I plan on making it double duty for hunting season and love the color for both hiking and hunting. Being able to separate the frame to attach quarters or a pack raft is awesome. The frame is very light and overall construction/ materials are durable. Thanks for the awesome pack and opportunity to make some fun new memories!
review.name: Terraframe 80 is the best all around pack

review.reviewBody: About ten miles with it so far. It carries well and feels great
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: I've had this bag for almost a month and it's been amazing. I've been using this for backpacking and in the future I'll be doing some camping in the spring, the frame in minimalistic but strong and offers amazing stability. The overflow feature on the frame allows me to carry a one person tent which is perfect but it can be used for so much more. The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 out of 5 is its a little lacking when it comes to pockets on the inside for organization, But that's a small price to pay for the 77 liters of storage which has been perfect for my needs. Another amazing product mystery ranch keep it up!
review.name: Amazing backpack.  But one small thing

name: Terraframe 80L Backpack
Terraframe 80L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I've used these pants hiking, rock climbing, and backcountry skiing and have been impressed by their versatility and hardiness. Some winter pants I've had in the past have snagged on rock, or pilled while glissading during a descent, but these show no signs of wear after heavy use. Being able to tighten the cuff for bopping around town is a super nice feature for after a big mountain effort ? not feeling like I need to change into normal clothes. Good weather resistant features all-around and nice fit.
review.name: Excellent All-Around Winter Pants

name: Incline AS Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots a month ago and glad I did.
review.name: Most comfortable boots I’ve ever worn

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I needed some waterproof, comfortable boots that are anti slip and could handle different terrain for a recent trip to Iceland. The boots handled everything really well. I'd consider Iceland to be an excellent place to test all aspects of these boots with plenty of opportunity for hiking, walking on sand, ice, mud, rocks etc. the only criticism I would have of the boots is that they are snug (guessing due to the goretex sock) and that they rub a little on your leg above your ankle. Plus points are they're super lightweight and very comfortable soles. I could wear them for many hours all day and wouldn't feel fatigued in my feet.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are really comfortable… I’ve spend walking around rocks the last 3 days and the grip is really strong.
review.name: Really comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice boots, comfortable and good in a long walks :)
review.name: Nice boots

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Little breaking in period, but nothing too lengthy.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just walked 70 miles with backpack over 5 days. Beefy. A real boot in a foam hiker.
review.name: Strong

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really wasn’t sure what to expect with these bouts, and now, I love them! The sole shape feels quite natural and isn’t tedious to get used to, very natural actually. Love them so far!
review.name: Excellent if odd shaped!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been a salomon fan for years, and these boots didn’t disappoint. I was intrigued by the description and specs. Support is like a mid but also soft around the foot. I did a 9.6 mile hike third day wearing them, no blisters or undue foot pain. Great grip on the sandstone but watch out for scree!
review.name: Elixir mid

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these for Christmas but didn’t put them to the test until July when I embarked on a (presently 2 months in) trek through BC. I’ve done a solid amount of day hikes in them and been overall pleased with their comfort and the confidence I feel with their traction and stability. That said, today we went for a hike on Vancouver Island following an evening of rain - not actively raining on the hike at all - and my feet got beyond soaked. I questioned myself, “I THOUGHT these were touted as waterproof”, and now checking back, they are. Soaked through just from damp brush; 6kms in at the summit I had to take them off and actually dump water out and wring my socks. All this is to say very comfortable and great grip, but absolutely don’t buy these with any expectations of dryness for inclement days.
review.name: Solid comfort + traction, terrible waterproofing

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a spring skiing shell -- didn't want to pay a ton and this is well worth it.   Lots of pockets (in the right places) and great weight makes it easier to layer as needed.   Only reason not 5 stars is it is a big baggy -- I am usually a large, which is what a bought -- so can't really complain -- prefer too big vs too tight around the hips.
review.name: great low-cost lightweight shell

review.reviewBody: I borrowed this jacket from a friend for the weekend and now I want one of my own. There are pockets for your pass, your phone, lift drinks, and an inner pocket for keys/ID etc. The cut of the jacket along with the color combo is super flattering (which isn't a make or break for my ski jacket but an added bonus). I was wearing a small and still had plenty of room for a fleece or puffy underneath. I typically wear a medium jacket, but the length of the jacket and the arms were longer than expected. I would recommend sizing down if you want a tighter fit.
review.name: Pockets Galore

review.reviewBody: I originally purchased the Julbo Cham sunglasses from Moosejaw. After arriving in the mail, they sat for awhile until an interested buddy came around. We both noticed that the right shield cannot hold on to the frame of the glasses. Mind you, I needed these for a specific glacier climb that was happening later in the year. So, I returned the items to Moosejaw - no issues there. Moosejaw replaced them without a hitch. However, there was a bit of a timing issue with the shipping, so I also ordered another pair from Backcountry. Both "new" pairs arrived at the same time. Upon opening both of the glasses for inspection, both of the glasses had the same original issue. What happens is when pushing downward on the left shield, the shield holds to the frame as pressure increases. On the right shield, however, only the slightest pressure would pop the shield off. The right shield will even just pop off when placing it on my or my buddies face. Kind of rendering the glasses to the point of untrustworthy, simply because I need and rather expect these glasses to be the kind that have shields that can withstand stronger than average winds and snow, rain, and sleet. Will be returning to Backcountry.
review.name: Good glasses and frame, poor side shield

review.reviewBody: Its does the job. I puted it atached at the frame, over my top tube, and I didnt noticed that it been there in my 110km Ride. I put a small Lenzine pump at the place of CO2 cartridge.
review.name: Very usefull for long rides

review.reviewBody: If you are a minimalist like me and hate wearing a pack but still want the essentials on your ride, then the Sendit Caddy will be perfect for you. It allows you to carry one tube, a C02 cartridge, a multi tool, quick link and a tire lever and then straps on to your frame. If you have an XS/S frame and are carrying a water bottle, then it will probably not fit underneath your top tube and must be on top. This caddy has neoprene pouches for padding, and they are labeled for each item. I think having separate, padded pouches is nice so you are never worried about dumping your stuff out while you are already frustrated by a flat tire. The straps are rubberized to prevent slippage and protects the frame but unfortunately it has moved on some of my rockier descent?s even having it pulled as tight as it would go. I do not believe it would ever fall off though. I think all in all this is the best minimalist storage option out there right now!
review.name: Lezyne SendIt Caddy

review.reviewBody: I love this coat. It is extremely warm and comfortable. It is long.....which i like, no need for fleece lined pants. I usually wear between an 8-10 (closer to the 10 size), I ordered a US 8  and the fit was perfect. There is room for a fleece or sweatshirt under the coat. The only thing a tiny negative is that the coat is HEAVY! not in terms of warmth but in actual weight. You don't notice it once you get it on, but it's heavy.
review.name: Great coat!

review.reviewBody: Ordered a size 11 & 11.5 after reading reviews that these tend to run small.  I normally wear standard width size 11 tennis shoes and work shoes.  These shoes are quite narrow - length  was OK on the size 11 but too narrow across the widest part of my foot..  The 11.5 was 1/2 inch longer (too long for me), and still too narrow.  These shoes appear well constructed and based on that I would recommend to someone who could get a good fit.
review.name: True to size in length, but too narrow

review.reviewBody: Bought this shoe 2-3 years ago Size 10. The new shoes are much narrower - can't even get foot in. Length next to older shoe is 1/2 size longer. No choice for width; very odd.
review.name: Runs Narrow&Long Compare to 2-3 YearsAgo

review.reviewBody: After 35+ years of teaching and trying all types of shoes, I hit upon the idea of trying hiking shoes. I figured if they can handle a rocky trail, they could handle a concrete floor. Oboz have a great footbed that cradle my feet and are so comfortable. They are lightweight so it doesn't feel like I'm wearing ankle weights. My feet don't hurt at the end of the day. I have 4 pairs; 2 sawtooth x low, 1 arete low, and 1 arete low waterproof. They are my go-to shoes every day.
review.name: Keeping me in the classroom

review.reviewBody:
I e worn Oboz Sawtooth 2 for 10 years and loved them. I saw the new Oboz Sawtooth X and thought it must be an improvement. I WAS WRONG. There is something different about the foot bed. The bottom of my feet hurt after hiking just a little over a mile. This happened on about 5 hikes so it wasn’t just a break in period. The shoes we were also very tight fitting in the width. 
I returned them and will go back to the Sawtooth 2.
review.name: Not like my old Oboz

review.reviewBody: Out of all the pairs of low hiking shoes I've used, this one is by far my favorite. The shape of the shoe is wide and comfortable to accommodate the natural shape of your foot. The shoe also has great grip. My only initial reservation is that they are not super breathable, so I might keep from wearing thick socks or stay away from them on any hot summer days. Overall, this is a comfortable pair of shoes and great for day hikes. #BackcountryGearhead
review.name: My New Go-To Hiking Shoes!

name: Sawtooth X Low Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Picked these up looking for a comfortable, lighter-weight short and these are on point. Very comfortable, good length for me (not too short or long) and lightweight fabric. Great for hitting the trails, fishing, wearing around town or whatever life brings. Plan to get more as these are becoming my new favorite shorts.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: I'm a 33 in everything else I wear and took a chance on a 34 in these as I had heard they run small. The 34 was still too tight to be comfortable. The legs were a bit large and flowy on top of this. Nope.
review.name: 34 runs small

review.reviewBody:
Gave this as a gift to my husband and has worn them all summer long.
Great casual and comfy short. Very light weight but made out of durable material.
review.name: GREAT OVERALL SHORT

review.reviewBody:
I'm never buying any other kind of pants
Why buy shorts AND swimming trunks? Why have more than 5 pairs of shorts?
Between these and the backcountry brand I am set for the next few years.
BUT, I'll be sure to come back here and buy another couple pairs when these are through.
I think that might be a decade or so though. Lifelong customer
The perfect gift too !
review.name: Love Hybrid pants.

review.reviewBody: Free! Get up To An Extra 20% OFF Coupons from coupon-bird. com (No space)
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: These are the ultimate utility shorts! I?ve routinely taken them from the bike, to the water, to the bar and they handle the task with aplomb! I love the internal draw string for fine-tuning the fit when they get wet.  Be warned though they will dry faster than your underwear.  Don?t wear undies and problem solved!
review.name: Don?t insult these shorts with underwear

review.reviewBody: Howler Brothers horizon 2.0 hybrid shorts are my new go-to shorts. Pocket layout is perfect with zippers and snaps just where you want them. Fit is perfect for me and runs true to size.
review.name: Amazing shorts - I own three pairs

review.reviewBody: I wear a size 33 waist in just about every brand I've come across.  I order these in 34 because 33 was not available at that time.  Received the shorts, great material, functional pocket layout, but they felt way bigger than 34.  Luckily they have a drawstring so you can cinch them up.  Flash forward a month, I decide to order another pair and do so in my usual waist size of 33. They arrive and I can barely button them.  I decided to keep them anyway.  Just be aware of the somewhat weird sizing.  Otherwise, a decent pair of shorts for water fun.
review.name: Trouble with sizing

name: Horizon 2.0 Hybrid Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Like JNCO jeans from the 90s? These may be for you. Got the XL after using the AI sizing tool from Backcountry - I was absolutely swimming in them. I’m 6’3”, 180 lb. 34” inseam. The legs are wide enough for legs. 

Material wise? Quality seems good. Don’t waste your time though cuz you’ll eat the cost sending them back.
review.name: What an awful cut don’t bother

review.reviewBody: This is less of a review of my bibs, although they look great, but for for backcountry as a company. I had such a hard time picking bibs and emailed them with questions, the staff was so helpful and when a package didn’t show up they were super easy to work with. 5 stars for backcountry I feel so safe and stoked to buy gear from them again.
review.name: Good fit and strong material

review.reviewBody: Nice looking pant. Good features. Tried both large x-large. Large was to snug around the butt and hip, no chance of a mid layer on a cold day. X-Large could of put basketballs down the pant legs or battled MC hammer…
review.name: Wanted to love, but couldn’t

review.reviewBody: Love fit, style,color options.  I bought 3!!
review.name: Best Bib

review.reviewBody: Purchased these since I've had my previous FL bibs for 10 years - durable, but worn down after several hundred days on them. I like these for the deep, white room & general skiing (I primarily ski Snowbird). Vents are great, ample pockets and adjustments. The only complaint is the inseam is a bit long for my "out of square" frame - 195#, 29-30" inseam. They are not "tight" around my belly & chest, but don't allow much in terms of base layers under the bib. I have to cinch the suspenders up so high so they won't bag up around my boots & bindings. I feel like a wedgie is coming on when I get low during cranking GS turns or blinding powder days. Hopefully these will last as long as my last pair & the sale price I paid is unbeatable
review.name: Great bibs - so far

review.reviewBody: I bought these before I went skiing in vail and they did not disappoint. We got almost 2 feet of snow while we were out there and these bibs were great for skiing the back bowls and tree runs while knee deep in powder. There's lots of pockets which are super convenient too.
review.name: Awesome bibs!

review.reviewBody:
Looks and feels like - High quality. 
Ordered the XL and the lowers fit but it was too snug around torso.
Ordered the XXL and it fit good around torso but the legs made it look like I was wearing a clown suit
For reference my measurements are 6’6” tall - 46” chest – 38” waist - “35” inseam
review.name: Weird Weird Weird Sizing unless your leg

review.reviewBody: Nuff said
review.name: These are dope

review.reviewBody: 5' 11" 175, the M fits me perfectly.  My only complaint is, I wish the inside cuff at the bottom of the leg was thicker/reinforced.
review.name: Love these bibs

review.reviewBody: 5'10" 195LBS ,The Large fit up top is very tight and not adjustable, "Unless ur a very skinny dude" ..The XL fit better but then too big on the bottom. Now i'm stuck with something that does't fit because i couldn't send them back in time. I had to send them back on my own dime and took too long i guess.....Do Better BC!
review.name: Terrible Fit

name: Baker Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: The back yoke on these pants had me hopeful that I’d finally found a nice fitting pair of rain pants. I don't let rain stop me from getting outdoors but I refuse to wear rain pants that look like a trash bag cinched at the waist. The back yoke is key. But these pants are huge. A XS is a full two inches wider at the hips than my old XS rain pants. I dinged 2stars for that and the ridiculously small snaps used that would be hard to negotiate with glove on , and there’s no tie at the waist to tighten when needed.
review.name: Details matter

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants specifically for the Olympic Peninsula trip I just went on. They were perfect. The day I used them it rained the entire time and we were hiking in the rain forest and along the river. I did not get wet.
review.name: Great rain pants

name: Highline Stretch Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great coat for travel as it folds up nicely.  Took on a trip and stayed warm.
review.name: Love my new coat

review.reviewBody: The days are warming up and I can’t wear this as often :( but works great for chilly mornings. Size small fit just right.  I have enough room if I wear a sweater yet not too loose fitting either.  It has a flattering waistline that wasn’t too fitted with the size small.  X-small would have fit just right but I would not have had the room to wear layers so I’m happy with the small.  I like the length a little below my hips. Arms were a little long but I’d rather have them longer to keep the cold out.  Has several pockets to keep hands warm, cell phone, keys, etc.  This is the perfect jacket I’ve been looking for to wear backpacking in the High Sierras.
review.name: Comfortable, warm, not bulky

review.reviewBody: After trying on hundreds of coats in the search for a lightweight down jacket that is flattering and actually keeps you warm without the bulk….I have around a keeper! Thank you Rab! This jacket is everything you could ever need or want!
review.name: Amazing jacket

review.itemreviewed: Wildfire Edge GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: awesome boot. light and long lasting.  Used this boot in a desert environment for 4-6 months of extensive hiking before signs of wear and tear

review.itemreviewed: Wildfire Edge GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these before they added the velcro flap to the cuff but I still love them.  Great control - they really do scramble a little like you're wearing a climbing shoe.  Comfortable right out of the box like my past Salewas, Before I used them I thought the sole looked thin but there was no issue on trails.  Maybe don't wear them all day on pavement.  No break-in necessary.  Love the all-black look.  Only a couple hundred miles on them but got in ~50 miles over 5 days summiting 14ers in Colorado and they were perfect for that.  Was concerned some of the thinner cords would get abraded but the boots are showing almost no signs of damage other than tread wear.  If they have a weakness I suppose it could be that the tread will wear off before the rest of the shoe reaches it's end.  Maybe Salewa can re-sole them?  Can't wait to use them in the Alps.  Buying a spare pair although I really think Salewa should keep making these for a while without changing them, they are such a great boot.
review.name: My favorite model from my current favorite shoe brand, versatile, excellent traction and control, more comfortable than I expected

review.itemreviewed: Wildfire Edge GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great boots.

review.itemreviewed: Wildfire Edge GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've used this mostly for hiking and snow/rock scrambling. I recently tested the waterproofness of this shoe on a 6-day iceland trip at hornstrandir on very humid conditions from rain, snow to marshy lands. While it performed well for a couple of days, water eventually leaked into the shoe making it damp at times, and with humid conditions it wasn't easy to dry them. I also tested the rubber compound while scrambling and the grip was excellent. The solid front of the shoe was great for inclined snow travel where I had to kick steps. The walkability of the shoe was ok, not very comfortable for longer distances as I started to have some hot spots from pressure on the front of my feet, but I suppose that's a sacrifice to obtain better climbing performance. One big downside is that I developed a very uncomfortable hotspot at my achilles/heel, almost though I had a blister. The built-in gaiters fit was ok, a little too big for my skinnier-than-average legs, and didn't prevent snow from getting into the inside of the shoes. Overall, performance was above average, tons of features, but could use some improvements.
review.name: Great approach shoe, best of both worlds, hiking + climbing

review.itemreviewed: Wildfire Edge GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Wildfire Edge GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent boots. Waterproofing is great. Wore them in the field for 5 days straight. They dry relatively quickly. The elastic upper keeps debris out of the boot which is nice. The grip is exceptional. Comfortable under load. Toe box is a little narrow for my foot however this is likely not the case for everyone. Overall I’m very happy with this purchase.

review.itemreviewed: Wildfire Edge GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: light weight, fits me perfectly! I plan to use this bag for multipitch climbing
review.name: light weight, fits me perfectly!

review.reviewBody: Love the size and fit of the backpack. It is super light but well made and sturdy. It doesn’t slide around in your back. It’s fit very well. And it’s a nice color! Very excited to continue using it. It’s a great size for easy day hikes where you need water, a snack, and a jacket with you.
review.name: Great backpack!!

review.reviewBody: I thoroughly enjoyed the first unisex version of the 15L vest. I ordered the Women's Small and there are noticeable improvements. I feel that it runs smaller than the Unisex XS. It feels very solid when not overloaded (i.e. in running vest mode). However, when loaded to towards max capacity I think I'd be slightly happier in a Medium. (5'5', 132lb, 32b/c). Regardless it's a pack I reach for consistently. I like that I can use as both a day pack and a running vest. Ideal for travel when you want to get a run in with hydration
review.name: Improvement from Unisex XS

review.reviewBody:
This bag fits great and is so good for so many things, so far hiking and even a bit of biking! 
So great to have such a versatile bag that can do more then one thing!
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody: This is an awesome day pack for hiking or long distance running pack for un-supported adventures.
review.name: Awesome pack!

review.reviewBody: recently decided that i was narrowing down the quiver to just two packs- this was my choice for short or long days and i am so happy i chose it . It carrys a substantial amoun of gear in a way that isnt unconfortable and is fialry water repellent. overalll a great choice
review.name: Perfect do it all pack

review.reviewBody: This pack is great: super comfortable and has everything you need and no extra bells and whistles. So far I've only used it on day hikes and on a few long trail runs and it holds up nicely. There isn't a whole lot of adjustability, so when I was running the pack moved around a bit. I ordered the smallest size and I am 5'0" and 110 lbs with a small chest. Sometimes I have to pull the chest straps all the way tight, so I wish there was one size smaller. But I think it will work great in the colder seasons when I have more layers. Can't wait to take this up some alpine routes.
review.name: Great performance

review.reviewBody: This is exactly the bag I want for a trekking in Torres del Paine national park
review.name: Best day backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack to go do a multistage race in Nepal called the Manaslu Stage Race. I needed something that could carry a bit more for being in high altitude and also knowing I would be waiting for my overnight bag to show up via the mules. The bag was the perfect size to carry the extra gear I needed to make sure I would be warm enough and all of the emergency gear I needed. I was able to carry a lightweight down jacket, thermals with fleece, emergency gear and spikes/poles. Plus, I loved that the top strap was adjustable so I could expand it if needed. It fit me perfectly and was comfortable to carry with no issues of it rubbing anywhere. My only complaint is the pockets on the vest. They are too small to fit water bottles. Very difficult to get them in and out, which is quite the pain. If they would fix this issue on the Distance Pack and the Beta 30 Fastback I would be recommending them to everyone. I just can't get past the hassle of the water bottles and I tried different sizes.
review.name: Almost Perfect Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far so good. I work in a hospital full time and am a full time student. I can organize all the gear I need for a normal, hectic day. I love the kick stand feature, as it keeps the bag upright and easy to find my needed gear. I have been an osprey user for all my life and this bag is just another reason to continue to do so.
review.name: So far so good. I

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this backpack.  I needed one bigger than my old Patagonia Black hole and this is just the right size, fits under seats on airplanes (is a little long but not bad).  I like the design/pockets.  The kickstand rocks.  It makes me feel like I'm carrying less weight because it is so well designed.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very happy with the Tropos 32, I'm still waiting for that big adventure to put the pack to the test. In the meantime, a trip to the Niagara Falls should be nothing for the unmatched quality of Osprey.

Looking forward to provide more input...

Adam
review.name: Very happy with the Tropos

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pack for carrying all of my books, computer and gym stuff to and from campus. Straps and suspension system carry the load well. The kickstand is also a really nice feature that I'm enjoying much more than I thought I would.
review.name: Great pack for carrying all

review.reviewBody: I can't imagine a better bag for its purpose. How about some more colors Osprey? Light or white perhaps for these hot summers.
review.name: more colors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've enjoyed using this pack for work mostly and travel. With minimalistic needs it can supply me with about a week's worth of clothing. In a pinch it is also a great way to have a day pack when I'd left mine behind on a trip. The lack of organization was a concern, but overall hasn't been that big of a deal and it does simplify the overall access to items within it. One thing that can be a bit of a slight annoyance is when overstuffing the main compartment it can limit the ease of access to the front organization area and laptop storage.
review.name: I've enjoyed using this pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Osprey equals quality, design, and service. With the Tropos, you get more of the same! It is the perfect pack for taking to college.
review.name: Osprey equals quality, design, and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When it doesn't have much stuff in it, the front part kinda starts folding in two. I usually carry my laptop charger in the middle section and it constantly bumps into the kickstand part making "bumping" sounds of it doesn't have anything else on top of it to fix it in place. If you have notebooks at the very front section, they upper part will "lean" out, forming a belly like bulgy shape on the front. I would love to have an option to hide/remove hip fixors and the ones on the front when I am not hiking. Otherwise, it is just great. I enjoyed hiking with it very much
review.name: When it doesn't have much

review.reviewBody: All Osprey bags were wonderful to try on at a local store, but I decided on this one. I ordered this one mostly because the “kickstand” bottom that is like their child carriers; it can be sat on the bottom and it stands upright. This is nice for school and casual uses because it doesn’t need to be leaned against something. I like that it’s also capable of having a camelbak in, but it carries 40oz containers on side pockets easy. The airframe back is nice because it lets you breathe and doesn’t get your back sweaty in the heat. I got this because I didn’t want to buy two bags, so this felt like something I could hike in or go to school in. It would only be more perfect with a built in raincover, but I bought the small one from here. The black is nice, but not completely blacked out as it’s slightly patterned. If they had a nice dark green I would have gone with that. Go try this one on, you will dig it.
review.name: Kickstand is amazing

review.reviewBody: I was looking to upgrade my trusty NF Surge. My Surge is still holding up well but I wanted to see if I could find a more comfortable pack. Go down the rabbit hole to find Osprey's Airstream and kickstand tech. Decide to check the gimmick and no shill it's great. I transferred my gear over and even though the Tropos weighs more than the Surge, my gear does feel lighter. The load lifters and the kickstand frame really do make a difference. I also wanted big stretchy pockets that will fit random items. I can stuff my travel pillow in one of the water bottle pockets without bulging out too much. The big stretchy pocket in the middle replaces the zip down from last generation which I can see why the zip was removed as I always thought that was just a invite for thieves to pull the zipper. The new stretch pocket needs the compression straps to be clicked in which does promotes security. Good pocket for rain gear and a tote bag. My cons for the Tropos are the waist strap and the padding at the bottom of the frame. Waist strap is just a ""why bother"" strap that is easily removed. The padding at the bottom is just me being nit-picky but it could do with some more padding. My Surge is now retired as my travel pack and the Tropos will join me on my adventures.
review.name: Awesome All-Arounder

review.reviewBody:
Needed a super lightweight harness for multi day Canyoneering trip with several long rappels. Worked fantastic with super comfortable rappels.
Will carry this harness for all my upcoming alpine climbs. The only thing I’ll probably do is add a backup to the skinny belay loop just for peace of mind.
review.name: Addux Harness - love it!

review.reviewBody:
This is an extremely lightweight harness that packs down to the size of a tall boy can and still manages to be a full-featured climbing harness.  I barely notice that I have it on when climbing and even hanging belays are fairly comfortable.  The dyneema belay loop has scared a few climbing partners but it's certified the same as any other harness and has shown no wear after months of 3x/week gym abuse.  There is basically no padding in this thing so if you're looking for a sofa-esque harness this is not for you.  On the other hand, this thing is fantastic for any type of gym climbing or single-pitch while taking up almost no room in your bag.  Build quality is great, no complaints.  Overall a quality product that's worth your money if you're looking for a very lightweight harness.

Note on sizing: My height and weight are below and a medium cinches down all the way but centers perfectly (which is exactly what Blue Ice told me when I emailed them about sizing).  My waist size is generally 30.
review.name: Excellent flyweight harness

review.reviewBody: I now have these one my mtb & gravel bike & will never ride without them. Been using them for 4-6 months with no issues. I love that the mtb version acts like a volume spacer in the tires calming tire rebound & allowing lower pressure with tire roll.
review.name: Love air liners

review.reviewBody: My wife and I have these installed in our DH bikes, E-bikes and our endro bikes, would not ride without them in the gnarly terrain we ride in. we can ride with far lower tire pressures for the best traction and reduced tire squirm, totally sold on these, one thing is though every once in a while we need to take them out and shorten them a bit as they seem to grow and then rattle a bit in the tire plus the valve core can block up and I need to poke a old spoke down to clear them, small price to pay for the protection and performance they offer, highly recommended
review.name: Best thing since suspension

review.reviewBody:
I got this after getting a my first pinch flat after a year of riding. I was a little paranoid, so I was running higher pressure (26psi) for my weight (135lbs). I was also checking my tire regularly after every run. 

After my last run, I ended up with a small pinch flat. Maybe it's coincidence, but my tire lasted only a day with this insert. Because the insert takes up so much volume the air volume in the tire is much smaller. So even a single burp can drastically reduce the pressure of your tire. Regardless of how it happened the insert didn't protect my tire from a pinch flat.
review.name: Pinch flat on day one

review.reviewBody:
I picked one of these up and installed it in the rear wheel of my hardtail. I usually run 25 PSI in my rear. I inflated to just over 20 psi with the insert installed and went for a test ride on a rocky trail. Within a mile of descending, I?d bottomed out and destroyed my rim. I don?t understand all the reviews gushing about running 10 or 15 PSI, as the liner didn?t do anything to save my rim even at a reasonably normal pressure.

I know a lot of people swear by these, but it just flat out didn?t work for me.
review.name: Still destroyed my rim

name: Air-Liner MTB Tire Insert

I only have a thermal/base layer and a sweater (not that thick) underneath this jacket. It is water proof as well. The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is because the medium size is too big and I cannot return it since it was a final sale. I wish to exchange it to a small size. I am 5'5", 135 lbs. I always like it a bit loose especially for a coat/jacket but this medium size is still too loose for me. Not sure if the small size will fit either. Also, it looks a bit too bulky.

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube GORE-TEX Golden Mantle Jacket - Women's

This one runs roomy.  I’m a bit over my ideal weight right now, so my other medium Marmot coats are a bit too snug with other layers beneath.  This one has plenty of space to layer.
review.name: Excellent jacket!

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube GORE-TEX Golden Mantle Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was a chistmas Gift for my wife and she absolutely loves it. As a person that's always freezing, this coat definitely is what she has been missing in the wintertime. We were out and about this past weekend and it was 30 °F and she wasn't chilly at all. She's been wanting a puffy type coat and was very excited to receive one. (Go me!)

It's super comfy, and the 4 pockets are great. I loved it so much, I bought one for my daughter in Alaska, and am getting another for her boyfriend.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Betalight 30 Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As an ultralight Backpacker, I leave my honest review here. First, I have to say that I was excited when I got this backpack; the fabrics and the implementation are outstanding excellent job Black Diamond. The fast backpack idea with those extra shoulder straps makes this backpack ideal. Not only is this one waterproof or almost, but it is merely one of the best backpacks I ever owned. Believe it or not, I have tried several UL backpacks in my career. The only downside I see is that the shoulder pocket with the zipper is too tiny to hold a standard-sized cell phone comfortably. If I had a bigger one, I could guarantee it would never fit inside.
review.name: Almost a perfect UL backpack.

review.reviewBody: As an ultralight Backpacker, I leave my honest review here. First, I have to say that I was excited when I got this backpack; the fabrics and the implementation are outstanding excellent job Black Diamond. The fast backpack idea with those extra shoulder straps makes this backpack ideal. Not only is this one waterproof or almost, but it is merely one of the best backpacks I ever owned. Believe it or not, I have tried several UL backpacks in my career. The only downside I see is that the shoulder pocket with the zipper is too tiny to hold a standard-sized cell phone comfortably. If I had a bigger one, I could guarantee it would never fit inside.
review.name: An almost perfect UL backpack.

review.reviewBody: I haven't used this pack but it looks great , with excellent materials, pockets and overall construction. It also seems to tick most boxes for ultra runners who may be doing multi-day events requiring a lot of mandatory gear. Some runners may question the design choice of having only one side of the vest strap capable of carrying a 500ml soft flask. Perhaps this is the preferred option for fastpacking but having capacity for two soft flasks in addition to two zippered pockets on either side like the BD Distance 15 pack would be ideal, at least for ultra runners.
review.name: Running vest construction

name: Betalight 30 Backpack

hasVariant.name: Maya 20L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Maya 20L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Maya 20L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Maya 20L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack for a girls week of hiking at Zion and Bryce national parks. We hiked all day everyday and I used this backpack for my water, lunches, snacks, and layers. It was perfect. It had of room for day hiking supplies and I loved the outside pouch for quick grab items. The backpack is very adjustable. My shoulders and back were never sore because the weight was distributed perfectly to my hips. I can’t recommend this backpack enough!
review.name: The Perfect Day Hiking Backpack

review.reviewBody: I received lots of compliments on this backpack. The color combination looks so beautiful. It's very comfortable. The front pockets hold my phone.
review.name: Many compliments

review.reviewBody: I had another brand's backpack and the fit wasn't right and the placement of the water bladder pocket was just plain stupid.  As expected, my new Gregory backpack fits just right with all the right pockets. I have a smaller one that I have been using for over 10 years.
review.name: Love Gregory backpacks

review.reviewBody: I got this pack on a coworker’s recommendation and I love it! I have already recommended it to several others. Holds all I need and more for dayhikes, whether 5 miles or 20 miles. Has great adjustability and the waist packs are super handy. Shoulder straps are comfortable.  I do wish the inside zippered mesh pocket was a bit deeper to hold a few more items I want quicker access to and would also have liked a brighter color choice. Nonetheless it is a great pack!
review.name: Great Dayhike Pack

review.reviewBody: I bought the Maya 20 to replace a Maya 18 I'd had for 10 years. Big, literally big, mistake. The new pack is 3 inches taller, 2 inches wider, and almost 2 inches deeper than the old one. The straps are wider and cut into my arms, even after adjusting the sternum strap. The hip belt is ginormous, 27-45 inches where the old pack fit 20-32 inches. Too bad there's no 18-20L in the kids sizes. I'm 5'6", 110 lbs, 17" torso.
review.name: Too big
comment: Hello, we appreciate your review and feedback. The product pages on our website should contain both the external and internal dimensions of all our products because we know how important it is for every traveler to have a pack that fits both their needs and belongings perfectly. That said, we're sorry to hear about your experience. We will reach out shortly to follow up and see if there's anything else we can do to assist.

review.reviewBody:
Love the fit! The adjustable torso length (with Velcro) is great. I was able to give myself a custom fit and it was like I didn’t have a pack on at all (weight was where it should be). 4 stars for the skimpy top pocket (barely fit three snacks, no room for a map) and the skimpy inside pocket. With the lack of pockets on the main pack, I also wish the expandable pocket had a tighter cinch closure. I was afraid to put anything small in there for fear of it falling out. The hole that you feed your bladder bite valve through could be a bit bigger too. 

I wish there had been bright colors. Felt kind of blah as opposed to my other 2 Gregory packs (raspberry and grape).
review.name: Adjustable fit is spot on. Pockets not so much.

review.reviewBody:
I love my new Maya 20 backpack. It’s beautiful, well made, and oh so functional! I also recommend the hydro reservoir you can buy to go with it! 

Gregory Packs has the best customer service. They worked with me to resolve an issue on my end and the representative was friendly, knowledgeable and professional. He resolved my issue in minutes! I would definitely buy from them in the future.
review.name: Amazing customer service!

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit, lightweight, love the color. Rests amazingly in my hips to help distribute the weight- perfect for quick day hikes- love it!!! For reference, I am 5’1 and 150lbs. Not skinny but not chunky, athletic build under some mom cushion lol
review.name: Perfect Fit!

review.reviewBody:
I have this in Iris Red and love the color!  (So tired of only blue & teal for women). The size is perfect for a day hike. I’m able to carry my essentials, food, hydration, puffy, fleece, shell and traction with tons of space left. I fill the outside stretchy pockets with bear spray, water bottle and sit pad. The hip belt pockets are huge and the shape is much improved over the previous Maya and carrie’s very comfortably.  I have two disappointments/suggestions for improvement: 1. Add the sunglass stow (there is a spot to attach a satcom or plb on shoulder strap)  2.  I almost always carry poles with me when I hike but for some reason, when attached to the pack, the poles lean over my shoulder, are in the way and very distracting as the pole handles are right by the side of my head, instead of carrying straight, as they do on my other Gregory packs. 

This pack really hits the sweet spot on size - definitely will be my go-to for most hikes.
review.name: Great go-to pack!

name: Maya 20L Daypack

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Lite Long Trekking Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: My most uncomfortable, expensive, pajamas. I say pajamas because that is about all they are good for. The pocket seems are coming undone, my items and hands slip through. I can see through the butt area just after a few months of wearing them. The fly zipper is already shot. The seams are coming undone in the crotch area as well. All these are good for is pajamas. Regret buying 2 pairs. I’ll stick to the Kebs from now on if I need to rely on a solid pair of pants in the field.
review.name: All these are good for is pajamas

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Lite Long Trekking Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this pants to be an all around pants that I can wear to hikes and outdoor activities, around town when I need pockets to carry things for my two toddlers, and for traveling due to comfort and the pockets. I can understand meeting all these criteria can seem impossible, but this pants comes very close! 
I am 6' 1" slender built (skinny legs and glutes), 160 lbs and strangely had to size up then take the already expensive pants to a tailor to have the waste taken in. As an avid hiker, I need some room in the legs otherwise the chafing would make these unusable. In terms of comfort, these are the most comfortable pants I've ever worn period! 

When it comes to looks, it has a distinct outdoorsy cargo pants look which would have been fine, but I do wish the stretch panels were not a different color... that's just not my style and I find it stands out in ways I wish they didn't (eg hard to walk in the neighborhood or on the beach without someone commenting on these pants... I prefer my pants not to be a topic of conversation). 

In terms of functionality, this pants hits the sweet spot: enough pockets to carry what I need but not too many like some other Fjallraven pants. The boot hook works great: I know this is meant to be for warm weathers, but I wear long johns under these and use the boot hooks to keep snow out of my boots and it works great for that purpose. I have not used the boot hooks in the summer. I tried to cinch the ankles with the straps, but like other reviews have stated the mechanism is finicky and can come undone by accident so I took them out. A size down (my usual size pants) would have made these leg openings too small to wrap around my boots... again I find the sizing on these pants strange. 

In addition to the contrasting colors, there are a couple things I don't like about these pants and frankly a bit surprised given the premium price: first, the zippers on the thigh pockets rub against my hands when I stride... wish they closed with the zippers towards the inner thigh. This is annoying and unnecessarily noisy on long hikes. Second, I wish the ventilation zippers opened from bottom up. The way they are now, I cannot use them without my boxers/boxer briefs showing which, let's face it, nobody wants to see haha. Finally, I know this is meant to be worn over boots which is why the leg opening is a wide boot cut, but I would be fine if it had a narrower opening which I think would have worked just fine.
review.name: Great pants with some flaws

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Lite Long Trekking Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: I buy all my Fjallraven trousers in 48/long but these seemed to run a bit large in the waist.  I sized down to 46/long and they fit more closely to the rest of my collection.  I've seen other reviews that say they run slim through the thighs and calfs - this is true.  I'm skinny so the slim legs don't bother me.
review.name: Some of my favorite Fjallraven.

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Lite Long Trekking Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: Lightweight and comfortable with some stretch in the legs. Would be perfect with two back pockets.
review.name: Comfortable Pants

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Lite Long Trekking Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: Hi, per usual great product, great material.  However the cuff has a band made of webbing that doesn't work properly.  The webbing is too long, first, so when you draw it all the way tight it drags on the ground.  Related to this problem is the fact that the webbing does not insert back into the slot in the cuff.  Again it's too long.  Secondly, the cinch pinches the cuff itself, so you have an awkwardly folded cuff that does not look or feel clean.   If the cuff were fixed, I'd endorse.  As of now, I asked for a return.
review.name: Bad Cuff System

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Lite Long Trekking Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: This pant is awesome for hikes in the summer. Nice and lightweight, great stretch in fabric allowing for ease of mobility and movement. Convenient zippered pockets for easy access, even has an inner hidden phone to secure phone (no phone bouncing around). My favourite go-to summer hiking pant that I'll always have!
review.name: Great Summer Hiking Pant

name: Abisko Lite Long Trekking Trouser - Men's

review.reviewBody: I use this shirt for morning workouts as well as out and about during the day. They are super soft and comfortable; so much so that I bought multiple colors.
review.name: I would purchase more of these shirts!

review.reviewBody: Soft comfortable breathable shirt. Can wear to the gym, out hiking, or work.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable breathable shirt. Also versatile with an ability to wear out hiking, to work or to the bar with friends.

review.reviewBody: I really enjoy this running shirt. I've been using it quite frequently and I am glad that I made the purchase.

review.reviewBody: I own more than 10 northface tshirts and all of them have the logo on the front chest and back shoulder. This is the first time i have a northface shirt without the iconic logo and just a simple tag at the middle top back which is soooo good! I will buy more colors as the material is very cooling and comfortable.
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: Great shirt for hiking and walking around the city on a hot day. Very light, comfortable and breathable material
review.name: I would buy this shirt in every color

description: Buy the Mad Rock Concorde Express Quickdraw Set - 6-Pack online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Concorde Express Quickdraw Set - 6-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mad Rock Concorde Express Quickdraw Set - 6-Pack online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The price is killer on these and these are my favorite addition to sport climbing. Super reliable, easy to clip and the low price makes me more comfortable to push my grades a little more.
review.name: Price and use

review.reviewBody: I've had a set of 12 for years now, it's the only sport draw I use.  Fallen on them many times.  While the paint is wearing off and they look worn, they still perform great.  Lightweight, easy to clip.  The dogbone is thinner than most brands but it's rated at 22kn and mine are still holding up (and I've climbed on them a LOT).  Bottom line, it's a great draw and I love them.  Nice that you don't have to pay premium prices for top quality.
review.name: It's a Great Draw

review.reviewBody: have had these for less than a month so far holding up with a couple of fall, has so light paint scuffing
review.name: So far So Not Dead

review.reviewBody: Excellent draws with a really smooth gate, never had an issue with these while I've had problems with far more expensive draws. Dogbone is a little short, but if you're worried about dogbone length just get some slings and turn these into alpines.
review.name: Great deal

review.reviewBody: I can not believe the qualiity of these quick draws. My draws also included the small plastic keeper at the top of the gray draws to keep them from turning when clipping. That piece is not shown in any photos but adds true appeal and value. The gates function just as you would expect on a more expensive draw. 10/10.
review.name: Amazing Value

review.reviewBody: My climbing crew pretty much all have these (found and purchased independently) since they are by far the cheapest and work well.  The newer ones (that I've seen made in 2019+) have the rubber "keeper" on the dogbone.  This aids in stiffness on one end, but since the event with Tito Traversa I always check for proper assembly before using (and you should too!)
review.name: No problems found

name: Concorde Express Quickdraw Set - 6-Pack

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Victory Screenhouse online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Victory Screenhouse
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Victory Screenhouse online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got the Victory Screenhouse in 2023 and have been loving it. Used it primarily in Washington state, but have also used it at the Grand Canyon and Yellowstone. If the screenhouse is all zipped up, it does block out wind very well, so if colder camping, it really helps keep it warm. It is pretty spacious and depending on the trip we designate it as the kitchen or pantry and hang out. We have a Snow Peak system that sets up beautifully inside. We have string lights we set up inside to bring ambiance in the evenings. Overall, LOVE this tent, though I'm a little sad to see the pole sleeves wearing after roughly 25-30 days/nights of use. I reinforced it recently with some Tear Aid to help minimize the breakdown of the fabric.
review.name: Our go to for every car camping trip

review.reviewBody: I like the high quality alternative to pop-up canopies. This one is solid and packs down well. However, it gets hot. On a buggy hot day, you’re out of luck. If I had some vents at the top to promote air circulation, I think it would perform better.
review.name: Too hot!

review.reviewBody:
What a great Basecamp Shelter! We use the Victory for a lot of Basecamp cooking both in the front & backcountry. I love the “step” zipper addition where you only need one hand to unzip the screen. Definitely comes in handy when we are out serving food to groups.
I usually double it up as my sleeping shelter too as I have ridden out many of storms in this shelter and still remain dry. The size and height of this tent is great for my 6’4 self and plenty of gear!
Definitely a great addition for any car camping or front country setup.
review.name: Great Shelter

review.reviewBody: Used this for my nieces and nephews to play in during the day while on a camping trip.  It was awesome because it kept the bugs and rain out!  You dont realize how great the screens are for also keeping sideways blowing rain out.  It also acted as a spot for them to keep their toys.
review.name: Great Sun/Kid room while camping!

name: Victory Screenhouse
