description: Buy the The North Face Green Kazoo Sleeping Bag: 0F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Green Kazoo Sleeping Bag: 0F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Green Kazoo Sleeping Bag: 0F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best bag I've ever been in, like it so much I've been using it everyday, seem to get better rest in it and it's comfort is higher than expected.
review.name: This will be the only bag I buy again and again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this bag for my son. He LOVES it! Padding in all of the right place and it is extremely warm thanks to the 700 fill down. It's perfect for my 12 year old son, but it would be a little too snug for me in the shoulder area (6'1" 185 lbs and long in the torso).
review.name: Great Sleeping System!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it, great quality
review.name: I would buy it again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used in Colorado. -30 degrees at night and never even felt a chill. Would highly recommend this bag to anyone.
review.name: I would buy this bag again and again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] GREAT bag. Incredibly comfortable, given I am a side sleeper who tosses and turns all night. It's so soft and cozy. Literally feels luxurious. Zipper is easy and holds fastened. The snuggly neck feature is nice as is the pillow pocket which doubles as a head cover. I will say, there was a little bit of condensation inside when my head was fully covered. But, it dried out really quickly. Took it backpacking and just stuffed it into my pack - no stuff sack needed plus it just filled up the empty space. Zero degree bags are heavy - but this one is light enough for hearty backpacking. LOVE this bag so much that I want to do even more cold weather camping just so I can use it more.
review.name: Side sleeper gives this a thumbs up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Solid down, fits well in its stuff bag. Was shipped quickly, the sleeping bag also wasn't compacted during shipping so the down is in good condition.
review.name: Good product, quick shipping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just got back from a backcountry trip in Colorado and this bag was amazing. We were camped at 10,500k where temps reached -20 and this bag did great. I was warm the whole night. One night temps were 10-15 degrees and had a foot a snow on the ground and I was sweating and had to move my arms out. I would recommend this bag to anyone.
review.name: I would buy this bag again and again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Haven't tried this out camping but did lay down it upon delivery. A beautiful bag that is very comfortable and warm. I plan to use this in New England's winter, and definitely think it will keep me warm at night.
review.name: Warm and comfortable, lightweight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfy
review.name: Super comfy and warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Kept my teenage son warm on a recent early October Mt. Whitney backpacking trip when temperatures dropped below freezing - he did wear all his other layers underneath for those two nights, but said it was otherwise perfect for the chilly 40s F weather. We put the sleeping bag in the wash after, and it fluffed back up nicely after a few days of air drying and a cycle on dryer with some tennis balls. Excellent!
review.name: High quality lightweight down sleeping bag

name: Green Kazoo Sleeping Bag: 0F Down

review.reviewBody: For a ride over 2 hours I can't wear anything but these (which is sad b/c I can't wear my team kit shorts).  I have been buying them for years.  Own more pairs than I can count (new ones are always best for an epic ride so I keep buying more, but they've generally held up).  The chamois is thick, as someone else noted, but for me, it's thick in all the right places.  I am 5'7" 130-135 pounds and I wear a size medium.  I have zero issues with the tightness on the legs - not too loose or too tight.  They make another style that is very tight in the legs (I have those too, I like these better).
review.name: Best shorts ever

review.reviewBody: I am 5'9" tall and about 150 lbs. These shorts are the best I've ever used for long rides. I am back for more!
review.name: Favorite Riding Shorts for Long Rides

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love these, but the leg bands were super loose. I'm 5'2", 137 lbs, and bought a large. Seemingly everything fit ok except for the weirdly loose, gap-y leg bands. They're being returned.

I really wish women's cycling clothing sizing wasn't all over the map& an Assos jersey I bought elsewhere to match these was a size Large, and I could barely get it zipped up. Again, I'm not huge - 5'2", 137 lbs, 36D, and I typically ride over 100 miles a week this time of year  (check my Strava). I'd love to know on what cycling companies base their sizing upon, but it doesn't seem to include regular avid women cyclists who aren't on a pro level.
review.name: Loose leg bands, as described by others

review.reviewBody: Tried these on, and the leg bands were too big.  They fit my legs, but weren't small enough to stretch and stay in place.  The chamois was also too big, as I sat down, I noticed my sit bones didn't come in contact with the cushy part of the chamois.  I used to be a small, and thought I should move up to a medium, but its just too big.
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: I really like the material but they are too long for my thighs.  They hit above my knee and the inseam is only 8.3 inches.  Not crazy about the thigh grippers, they were too loose.  The chamois was a little bulky when I tried them on but you really need to go on a few rides first.  If they fit right, this short is meant for long rides.  My quest continues for the right short for my build.
review.name: Too long for my short legs

review.reviewBody: These fit me well in the waist and legs with the exception of the leg band. It was really tight, far tighter than the rest of the leg, and cut into my leg way too much. My biggest problem was the chamois, though. It?s huge. It?s bulky. There was so much bulk out to the sides that within 10 miles my legs and feet were numb and my undercarriage was sore and very unhappy. You just don?t want your undercarriage to be more unhappy than necessary on a bike and I couldn?t wait to get home and take them off. By comparison, my Castelli Velocissima shorts have never made me cut a 4 hour bike ride off after 10 miles and constantly shift on the saddle in desperation to get feeling back in my legs.
review.name: That chamois...it?s huge

review.reviewBody: I liked the fit of these shorts, but the chamois was too bulky for me. That's a personal preference, and other than that, they seemed like really nice shorts.

description: Buy the Snow Peak Mokumo Smoke Meister online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mokumo Smoke Meister
hasVariant.description: Buy the Snow Peak Mokumo Smoke Meister online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
First thing you need to understand is that this smoker is very small, so you will be able to smoke 12 chicken wings, 8 thighs, 4 fish filets etc. With that in mind the performance of the smoke is really good and it makes very flavorful food. It is extremely stingy with the fuel and can smoke most things with one chunk of wood and a couple charcoal briquettes.

It is highly portable and would make a great smoker at a campsite, especially to smoke some fish that you caught or smoke something as part of a meal or appetizers.

Overall I think it is well made (it is Snow Peak) and does its job well, just understand the size. I have attached a  video from Dickin' Around Outdoors where it is used and reviewed. There are two but this one is the initial thoughts video.
review.name: Neat Design But Very Small

name: Mokumo Smoke Meister

review.reviewBody: Kept looking at the lenses wondering how I was getting smudges, was I accidentally touching the lenses when wearing or when adjusting…nope, was from my eyebrows duh lol. Even worse when it’s hot and you’re sweating.
review.name: Great shades if you don’t have eyebrows

review.reviewBody: Love the Boomtown shades so much! Now Have them in two colors! Received compliments on the blue mirror lens and now, compliments on the red/orange ones that I just got. Love the coverage, style and protection. Thank you, Smith!
review.name: Things that make you go Boom!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic polarization, and great field of view…. It’s very hard to see the frames while wearing them. I use these glasses while working on blue water and inshore. I have no complaints whatsoever.
review.name: Great fit, great lenses.

review.reviewBody:
I love the glasses, but they really don’t work well and direct sunlight.

My eyes are very sensitive to the sun and direct sunlight can be quite painful with the glasses on.
review.name: I love the glasses, but

review.reviewBody: Great look. Perfect fit. Just a tad big for my face, but great wind and sun protection during bike rides. I'm sure these will perform well on the ski slopes as well. Solid A rating.
review.name: Look/fit/size/performance

review.reviewBody: Light and sleek looking shades. Your mileage may vary but me having a typical asian face shape, the frame rests on my cheek bone before the nose pad gets a chance to land on my nose bridge
review.name: Asian Beware

review.reviewBody: Great coverage in a shield type frame staying shy of full “I’ll beat you!” Mode. Style is cool enough to still wear to the brewery.
review.name: Versatile and stylish

review.reviewBody: These are by far my favorite of my 3 pairs of Smith's. The fit and coverage is great. They are nice for just casual wearing but also work great on the bike, river, or anything other sport you're doing.
review.name: Favorite Smith glasses

review.reviewBody:
Gotta agree with a couple other reviewers, that these have that “gas station” low quality feel. The arms jiggle at the hinges, and the frames appear fragile and likely to crack under consistent wear. 

I have older Smiths that are far and way better in terms of arm action, and frame quality. I like the look, but can’t recommend these. They feel like 20 buck glasses from a rotating rack.
review.name: Not the Smith quality I’m used to.

review.reviewBody: gas station quality! Completely disappointed and frustrated how low quality the brand is. Charging designer prices for gas station quality products. Feels extremely cheap and the had loose screws.
review.name: Complete and utter garbage

name: Boomtown ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are the perfect winter boot! I have wide feet and these are still very comfortable. The insulation level is great, not too much for wearing inside but warm enough for standing on snow or ice. They are also cute enough to wear around mountain towns and at the ice rink! I’ve had these boots fit three years and I’ve worn them a ton and they have held up great.
review.name: Love these boots!!

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m normally a 9 in boots; however these were so tight…I had to return them. I would size up
review.name: So tight!

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these about 6 months ago.  I have worn them a lot.  They have worked nicely except both boots have split down the seam.   I probably would understand if these shoes didn’t cost at so much, but they’re almost $200.  It was a big purchase so I’m a bit sad they haven’t lasted as long as I had hoped.  Not sure what to do about it, but I would not buy again.  Maybe if the company would repair them or replace them, then I would recommend their product, but I haven’t tried getting touch with the company yet.
review.name: I did like them

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love my boots! They are cute and functional. They have a great mountain town look to them, but also keep my feet warm. The arctic grip rubber really does work too - they have great traction. Very comfortable from the get and true to size.
review.name: My Go-To Winter Boot

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: True to size, warm and good traction (although recommend Icebugs for ice). I struggle with footwear - high arch, narrow heel but need room for my forefoot. Often I am left with a blister. Not these! Love them.
review.name: Great for winter hiking!

name: Sphinx Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: when I opened this hoody I was amazed how light weight it was. when I put it on I was immediately impressed with the feeling. the outside is soft and smooth and I do worry about snagging it, but no problems so far. Given the light weight I was not expecting it to keep me warm but it has a lovely fleece lining. I have been wearing it over a t-shirt in these autumn conditions and it has done the job. I bought red and love its vibrancy and I may come back and get the blue and maybe one for my brother for xmas
review.name: feels awesome to wear

review.reviewBody:
I recently bought a tule foothill after sell an older rrt.
Very pleased with the quality and overall sturdiness of this tent. The layout is great for fitting more toys on the rack beside it for all kinds of adventures .
review.name: Great rrt

review.reviewBody: Very spacious when in use and sleek when traveling. After the learning of setting up and putting back to its compact traveling size set up is getting easier each time
review.name: Awesome product!

review.reviewBody:
Easy to install 
Confortable tent
Even a t 6’5’’ it’s confortable and big enough to move around while being small to store easily and carry arround
review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody:
We’ve only set up the tent when first received. Which was delivered very quickly. However, during set up, the brackets that come with the tent was a pain… while slowly attaching each bolt, we thought- there must be an easier way. Looking back in the website we found out that there is in fact a quicker set up. For an extra price of course. Our thing is… ok, Thule recognized there to be a better system and instead of just giving that to us, we’re forced to pay the extra bucks. I get it- name of the game but dang… throw us a bone. 

Other than that- the tent seems like it’s going to be an awesome upgrade and we are excited to try it out. We’ve read lots of folks complain about the zipper positioning but we won’t know how we feel u til we try. Also, when putting on the cover, be careful. The threading has already come up a little as we fitted it on…
review.name: Too early to know. But..

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Foothill for about 6 months now. There have been several issues mostly with the cover and straps. Once set up I actually love the tent. I live in SoCal so I can often sleep with the top open and fall asleep under the stars. Sure it takes a bit more time to set up but once you figure you your system. I can get it set in less than 10 minutes and packed up in about 15. I agree with a lot of the reviews on here though ... the cover and straps and zipper fall apart very quickly. Ive used the tent about 2 dozen times and started having zipper issues by the third time. I started making sure I had bungie cords and ratchet straps with me at all times knowing it was just a matter of time before the zipper would completely fail. I've had to fix it several times but this last trip it completely failed and I had to strap it up to get home safely. I got home and went to the website to order replacement parts and unfortunately on the parts I need there is no description. And you can't call anyone for customer support with questions. My firs being is the zipper upgraded from the original. I have Gen 1 model. Does the zipper come with both sides or just the side attached to the cover. I know that sounds like a silly question but I am not surprised by much these days and I could see that being sold separately. If the zippers is the same as the original from V1 … I will pass and get rid of the tent because I’m certain I will run into the same problem in a few months.
review.name: Zippers …. Argh!

review.reviewBody: Hello I have been using my new tent for a couple weeks. The cover tgat goes over the tent that zips up, the zipper that’s plastic broke the first week. Everything else I love about the tent. It’s really fun to camp in. I will have on display at overlanding shows. Are y’all able to send me a new cover that goes over the tent please?
review.name: Tent review

review.reviewBody:
My only complaint is there is no storage for the ladder on the roof top tent or travel cover; would be nice if a pocket or something could have been stitched into the travel cover or a place to strap it to the top before you put the cover on so the ladder stays with the tent at all times (might end up doing).  
Almost forgot it on my second trip...Would have given a 5 star if not for this.
review.name: Great tent to go beside the Thule Cargo Box

review.reviewBody: I love this tent but agree with a previous reviewer that the cover is garbage! The straps rubbed multiple holes in the cover after only a few months of use, allowing water to get in when it rains. (We do store the tent I side all winter). Unfortunately, we purchased the tent secondhand so have no proof of purchase and can’t file warranty claim. The fabric or strap system needs to be fixed.
review.name: Good tent, bad cover
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback, Nicole. 
I'm sorry to hear about the damage to your Thule Foothill cover. Thule always recommends removing accessories from the vehicle when not in use. While Thule rooftop tents are designed to withstand outdoor use, prolonged exposure through the course of several months can cause additional wear and tear beyond what the tent is designed to endure.
Holes caused by rubbing are also usually an indication that the straps are too tight. They should be snug, but just loose enough to fit a few fingers between the strap and the tent. 
While used products are not covered under Thule's limited lifetime warranty, replacement covers can be purchased through the Thule.com spare parts and instructions page. Thule has actually updated the cover on the Thule Foothill so this should no longer be an issue for current models.

review.reviewBody:
I mounted the Foothill RTT on the camper shell of my Tacoma and absolutely love it. I like that it only takes up half the roof which leaves room for other gear. The Foothill has been with me on some epic adventures and even withstood a 60mph unexpected windstorm on the mountain.

One thing I'll note. Other purchasers mentioned that the cover is a pain to open given that it unzips toward the middle of the car. I pulled the cover off, turned it around, and now it unzips the correct way.
review.name: Great Compact RTT!

review.reviewBody:
I love this tent for it's compact size, giving me much needed extra roof space for my other adventure gear 
The BIGGEST gripe I have is how the cover unzips from the BACK side. A real challenge on a Sasquatched Bronco!
I made a video on how to swap the cover on my YouTube channel, TLOverlander
review.name: Backwards cover?? This is how to fix that!

name: x Tepui Foothill Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

hasVariant.name: Class V Skort - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Class V Skort - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This skort was very nice and well made, but ultimately I had to return it because I don't have hips and this was designed for someone much more hippier than moi.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits great! Good quality. Fast delivery.
review.name: I would recommend this item over and over!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was disappointed by the fabric, it was very stiff.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this Skort, fits great, looks great!! Nice weight and comfort to fabric. Love so much, I went back and purchased two more!
review.name: Love Love Love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality per usual from The North Face
review.name: Would buy this again!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The first skort I ever bought was from The North Face. I'm so happy I did, wearing a skirt, without worrying I might be standing in my underwear if I bend over, is something my closet very much needed. I've been wearing skorts ever since, I actually don't like to wear normal skirts anymore. Now I'm trying to get skorts in different colors, and I didn't have pink yet. Little did I know, but this pink is so beautiful, it actually became my favorite skirt. It looks very classy and elegant, I even wore it too a more formal meeting. Please keep making skorts! I love them!!
review.name: Not only beautiful but also very practical

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] In the beginning I wasn't sure about the color, but after wearing it, it became my most favorite skort. I love it that you don't have to pay attention if you're bending over to pick something up, I love it that I can go on the bike with it. This skort looks really pretty and even classy, it's great. Size is about right. I would definitely buy this one again
review.name: My most favorite skort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a must-have in your closet, your trunk, or in your backpack. These are so comfortable to hike, lounge or play in. I can pair them up with my hiking shoes during the day, and change into a pair of booties as I reward myself with a glass of vino, after.
review.name: Love, love, love!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This skirt is very cute and very comfortable. Th lack of pockets is a bit frustrating.
review.name: Needs Pockets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore this skirt for 3 days on the Appalachian Trail while hiking in very high temperatures (mid-nineties). I found this skirt to be extremely airy and cool with a very comfortable waistband. It is also very flattering and looks great with a tee-shirt. I love-love-love it and would highly recommend.
review.name: Too Cool Hiking Skort

name: Class V Skort - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Grivel G Zero Ice Axe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Having  owned wood Stubai and heavy Black Diamond axes as a younger man, I was ready for something lighter as an "aging hotdogger." In my 70's, keeping pack weight down is IMPORTANT. My souls is still young, my body not so much.

The Axe is an excellent length for typical higher angle snowfield use where steps must be pulled or cut, and is perfect for arrests from any position. AND LIGHT!  STURDY!  This is the last axe I'll ever need to buy.
review.name: Great Axe - SO LIGHT!

name: G Zero Ice Axe

review.reviewBody: I wear a women's size 7M. After reading reviews and measuring my foot, I ordered these in a 37.5. Unfortunately, they were too small. I reordered a 38 and they fit perfectly. They aren't cavernous like most trail/hiking shoes. They are a slim fit, no garage-sized toe box, which I abhor. They are nice looking, comfortable and have good traction and support.
review.name: Very nice looking...run small.

review.reviewBody: They are beautiful and super comfortable right from the get go. One word of caution, Read the size chart. I wear an 8.5 so ordered 38 but needed a 40.....which the chart indicates us a size 8.5.
review.name: Love my Scarpa trail shoes

review.reviewBody: I ordered this jacket expecting to be disappointed by the sizing; I am short and stocky and often find that sleeves are ridiculously long when I order an XL. This jacket fits great in the sleeves, shoulders, midsection--everywhere! I love the underarm vents and hood is effective. I've worn it in downpours during our unusually rainy summer and come out dry every time. Very glad I bought it.
review.name: Perfect for me

review.reviewBody: Like what I said in the title, I didn’t receive the jacket. Instead, a short pants sent to me which even not in my size. I sent an email but didn’t get any reply.
review.name: You sent me a wrong product
comment: We are sorry to hear that you received the wrong item and that it wasn't in your size. We understand your frustration with the shipping error and our lack of email response.  Please check your inbox for an email from our team regarding this issue.

review.reviewBody: I've already used this rain jacket multiple times since I received it a month ago, and it has performed so well. The rain just beads up on top of the jacket and rolls off, not penetrating the fabric at all. I got the white and it can get some marks on it which are difficult to get off, so if that's an issue for you I'd recommend getting one of the darker colors which I think would remain pristine for longer.
review.name: High performance yet fashionable

review.reviewBody: My fiance and I both have these jackets.  We wore them this week on a trip in the white mountains here in NH. Winds were 40-50 mph and blowing snow and the jackets are a totally a protective shell !
review.name: Blow me away

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful jacket but it is fairly fitted.  I returned a small for a medium because I like to wear a fleece vest or sweater under a raincoat in the fall and early spring.  I am  older and do not care about a sleek look.  I just want to keep the rain off, so I can hike and walk my dog in rainy weather.
review.name: beautiful jacket

review.itemreviewed: Cressida Cork Lite Trekking Poles - Women's
review.reviewBody: Well made hiking poles, seem sturdy enough. Would recommend to a friend.
review.name: Great quality

review.itemreviewed: Cressida Cork Lite Trekking Poles - Women's
review.reviewBody: I want to thank Leki for these great Cressida Cork Lite poles which they provided to me at no cost in fulfillment of a warranty for another pair/different model that had a defect.  These poles are sturdy and light and give me confidence on the trail, even on steep inclines or descents.   It's very easy to change the length of the poles as needed and I like the women-specific sizing since I am on the petite side and don't need more pole length than necessary.  The cork grip is very comfortable!  I wasn't sure how I would feel about a cork grip since I was previously used to a foam grip, but I think there's actually more stability and palm to pole contact with a cork grip.  I am also not used to aluminum, which is indeed stiffer than carbon, but I think it's worth it to choose aluminum for Leki's great warranty.  Leki stands behind its products and I will only buy Leki poles from now on.  Thank you!
review.name: Sturdy and easy to use

name: Cressida Cork Lite Trekking Poles - Women's

description: Buy the Park Tool Grease Gun online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Grease Gun
hasVariant.description: Buy the Park Tool Grease Gun online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
First world problems.

I have used some form of grease guns or similar grease delivery products all of my life.  This appears to be a quality built product, but it seems to have a couple of issues for me.  After multiple attempts, I have been unable to effectively bleed the unit so that it will deliver a full pump of grease.  When I depress the applicator, I am only able to get grease from the final 20% of the pump.  

My other issue is its inherent, top-heavy instability.  With the given design, the base is narrow and the upper makes this top-heavy and it wants to easily fall over.  If it had a broader base plate to offer stability, I might be more pleased with this.
review.name: Acceptable, but...

name: Grease Gun

review.reviewBody:
Good news - These fenders look good on my Surly Preamble and keep me dry on rainy days. Build quality seems fine. These fenders are made of decent quality plastic and aluminum, but the edges of the plastic fenders were irregular and rough. Overall, the build quality is probably a little low for the price you're paying. 

Bad news - These fenders took me multiple hours to install and required me to make up my own installation process. I already had a hint of what I was getting into when I bought these fenders as I had done some research on what was required. I knew that I would need to cut the struts to length, and I figured that would be a relatively straight-forward process. Unfortunately, that was not the case. 

The instructions provided by SKS are a bit bizarre, and instruct you to cut the struts while attached to your bike. I don't know about you, but cutting struts right next to my bike frame with a hacksaw seems like a really bad idea. When you do cut the struts, the black paint used on them starts to flake off, so you have to be really careful about getting a nice clean cut if you want to maintain the look of the struts. Why SKS didn't recommend a simpler method (such as using a strong wire cutter versus a hacksaw), I'm unsure.

Next, the bolts provided by SKS to attach the fenders to your frame come in three sizes. Unfortunately, all three of the sizes were either way too big or way too small. That means that I had to cut multiple bolts by hand in order to get them to a size that didn't interfere with the brakes, wheels, etc.

Finally, the method SKS uses to make these "disc brake compatible" (mentioned on the FAQs of their websites) is to just stack a bunch of spacers between the fork and the struts. Unfortunately, the spacers are not a great fit around the bolt and if you need to stack a few (I needed 7 on my front fork), they look horrendous as each one is offset from the other. I actually ended up 3D printing my own spacer to get around this.

Overall, the installation process was atrocious, and I'm saying this as someone who had all the tools available and had a successful end result.
review.name: Looks good but atrocious installation

name: Bluemels Full Coverage Fender Set

review.reviewBody: I wasn't expecting much when I ordered this board bag. I mean... it's a bag, how great can it be? But after using it on a few trips, I'm really happy with it. The material has held up well to commercial airline travel so far. The stitching is all bar tacks and seems durable. The roll up feature with the modular handle that clips to the webbing is a good idea and works well. You can place the handle right where you need it. The bag has multiple handles along the top face so you can pick it up however you want. And the bag holds at least 3-4 boards, plus clothing and bindings and boots if you pack like a pro. The only downside is TSA will open the bag to inspect. And they rarely put it all back together properly. I place the dual zippers in the center of the bag's length so they don't have to unroll the top. But they do anyway. I'm pretty happy with this thing. Better than the Dakine I've been using for the last few seasons.
review.name: Pleasantly Surprised

name: Snow Roller Pro

review.reviewBody: Comming from spd, to these were easy, comes in greased, at first it doesnt spin as much gave me time to get used to it, then it became smoother the more i use it. Bonus it comes with the cleat, my first time buying pedals, so i wasnt aware. Budget wise its a bang for buck. Would recommend for people who wants to try spd from mtb cleats.
review.name: Awesome, comming from spd to spd-sl

review.reviewBody: There is up and down movement when clipped in no matter how tight I get them. The Dura-ace pedals on my outdoor bike do not have this issue.
review.name: Pedals will not hold the cleats tight

review.reviewBody: I bought these to put on my single speed and they work like you would expect a shimano pedal to work. However, there are a few things to consider: The pedals are made out of a hard plastic with metal contact points (not chromoly like the old ones). Also, they tend to flip upside down after clipping out; so clipping back in can take a little getting used to (the old metal version was much more balanced). Bottom line: For a pedal at this price point, they do a good job. Would I put them on my carbon road bike? Definitely not. However, if you have a secondary bike you ride at a more casual pace, these pedals do what they are supposed to do and don't cost a fortune.
review.name: Nice and cheap

review.reviewBody:
Just installed them on the indoor bike for my wife. She did a quick 5 min 'ride' to test them out and get the cleats fitted. She said she could already tell they will make a huge difference. The plan is to keep them on the stationary bike so she can get used to them and until the nice Spring weather lets us ride outside again, then ill put them on her road bike. 
I really appreciate how easily they adjust too.
review.name: Great so far

name: PD-RS500 Pedals
